h3: I am a Data Engineer Intern at BMW of North America, and a third year student studying Computer Science at the New Jersey Institute of Technology. When I'm not doing work, you can find me taking walks with my dog, Niko!

school: New Jersey Institute of Technology, Albert Dorman Honors College
coursework: Data Structures, Internet Applications, Data Science, C++, Java, Discrete Math
other: Recipient of the NJIT Honors Full Ride Scholarship, Dean's List Scholar

workExperiences.whatIDid: Developing a dashboard that enables business users to understand more about their transaction data
Developing a dashboard that enables business users to understand more about their transaction data
Developed Web Application to help destigmatize and educate minority communities on investing with Capital One. Hackathon finalist.
workExperiences.stack: HTML/CSS, JavaScript, TIINGO API, Python - MatPlotLib, Pandas

professionalDevelopment.whatIDid: Participating in a rigorous, application-only professional development program aimed at accelerating my career in software engineering, focusing on enhancing technical and leadership skills within the tech industry.
professionalDevelopment.stack: Data Structures and Algorithms, Software Engineering Principles, Technical Interview Prep

professionalDevelopment.whatIDid: Selected for a competitive fellowship program aimed at empowering underrepresented students in technology through mentorship, career development, and hands-on software engineering projects.
professionalDevelopment.stack: Technical Interview Prep, Software Engineering Principles

professionalDevelopment.whatIDid: Completing a rigorous technical interview preparation course throughout the summer.
Completing an intensive, project-based course focusing on intermediate web development concepts, including front-end development and React.

volunteerWork.whatIDid: Elected to the Computer Science Representative Position of the NJIT Student Senate with a focus on improving diversity, equity, and inclusion in the Computer Science program through increased promotion of uplifting programs for minority Computer Science Students.

volunteerWork.company: NJIT National Society of Black Engineers
volunteerWork.whatIDid: Leading a team building a chapter website with HTML/CSS, JavaScript, and Google Sites for NJIT NSBE. Maintaining effective communication between NSBE and other campus organizations for effective collaboration

Led weekly lectures to facilitate the transition of incoming first year students to collegiate life. Evaluated and provided feedback on essays, resumes, and guided students through a biodiversity project aimed at enhancing ecological diversity on campus.

Performed comprehensive code analysis and actively contributed to the design of a STEM-focused curriculum to teach young students from Hawthorne Avenue Elementary School in Newark, NJ. Utilized Scratch to help teach the students coding principles, while diving into more complicated code related to drone technology.
